00033 class AccumulatorConnectorListener : public ConnectorListener
00034 {
00035 public:
00036         /* @brief constructor */
00037         AccumulatorConnectorListener();
00038         /* @brief destructor */
00039         virtual ~AccumulatorConnectorListener();
00040 
00041         /* @brief callback function to receive data */
00042         virtual void MessageReceived(Service& TheService, const SimpleString LocalConnectorName, const Message& Msg);
00043 
00044 private:
00045         Mutex Locker;           
00047         float Accu;                     
00048 };

00053         /* @brief constructor */
00054 AccumulatorConnectorListener::AccumulatorConnectorListener()

00057         Accu = 0.0f;
00058 }

00065         /* @brief callback function to receive data */
00066 void AccumulatorConnectorListener::MessageReceived(Service& TheService, const SimpleString LocalConnectorName, const Message& Msg)
00067 {
00068         // Error management
00069         bool IsWrong = true;    // by default, the command is wrong
00070         SimpleString ErrorMessage = "Bad command.";
00071 
00072         // Which operand ? 3 will be read by the integer and 3.5 will be read by the float
00073         int dRightOperand   = 0;
00074         float fRightOperand = 0.0f;
00075 
00076         // A pointer to the command line and to the begining of the usufull data
00077         char * Command;
00078         int  StartUsefullInfo;
00079 
00080         // parse string to understand command
00081         // Start lock myself using my mutex (needed if multiple clients)
00082         Locker.EnterMutex();
00083 
00084         // Get the pointer to the data
00085         Command = Msg.GetBuffer();
00086 
00087         // skip data while there are spaces...
00088         for( StartUsefullInfo = 0; Command[StartUsefullInfo] != '\0'; StartUsefullInfo++ )
00089         {
00090                 if ( Command[StartUsefullInfo] != ' ' &&  Command[StartUsefullInfo] != '\t' &&
00091                          Command[StartUsefullInfo] != '\r' && Command[StartUsefullInfo] != '\n' )
00092                 {
00093                         break;
00094                 }
00095         }
00096 
00097         // Is it a legal command ?
00098         if ( Command[StartUsefullInfo] == '-' || Command[StartUsefullInfo] == '+' ||
00099                         Command[StartUsefullInfo] == '/' || Command[StartUsefullInfo] == '*' ||
00100                         Command[StartUsefullInfo] == '=' )
00101         {
00102                 // look for a float like 3.14 and then for 
00103                 if ( sscanf( &Command[StartUsefullInfo+1], "%f", &fRightOperand ) == 1 )
00104                 {
00105                         IsWrong = false;
00106                 }
00107                 // else IsWrong == true;
00108 
00109                 // If it is ok, 
00110                 if ( IsWrong == false )
00111                 {
00112                         // run the command
00113                         switch( Command[StartUsefullInfo] )
00114                         {
00115                                 case '-':
00116                                         // Compute new value
00117                                         Accu -= fRightOperand;
00118                                         break;
00119 
00120                                 case '+':
00121                                         // Compute new value
00122                                         Accu += fRightOperand;
00123                                         break;
00124 
00125                                 case '*':
00126                                         // Compute new value
00127                                         Accu *= fRightOperand;
00128                                         break;
00129 
00130                                 case '/':
00131                                         if ( fRightOperand == 0.0f )
00132                                         {
00133                                                 // we can not divide by 0
00134                                                 IsWrong = true;
00135                                         }
00136                                         else
00137                                         {
00138                                                 // Compute new value
00139                                                 Accu /= fRightOperand;
00140                                         }
00141                                         break;
00142 
00143                                 default:        // here, Command[0] == '='
00144                                         Accu = fRightOperand;
00145                                         break;
00146                         }
00147                 }
00148         }
00149         if ( IsWrong == false )
00150         {
00151                 // export the new Accu value, so the clients will receive notification
00152                 TheService.SetVariableValue("Accu", Accu);
00153         }
00154         else
00155         {
00156                 // Discard value and send back to the rigth "person" an error message in safe mode (TCP/SHM - when implemented)
00157                 TheService.SendToOneClient( LocalConnectorName, (char*)ErrorMessage.GetStr(), ErrorMessage.GetLength(), Msg.GetPeerId(), false );
00158         }
00159 
00160         // Unlock myself 
00161         Locker.LeaveMutex();
00162 }
00163

00166 /* @brief main program entry for the Accumulator. No need to give parameter */
00167 int main(int argc, char*argv[] )
00168 {
00169         // Instanciate a Connector listener (must *not* be destroyed before it has
00170         // been removed for the connector or until the service is destroyed).
00171         AccumulatorConnectorListener MyCommandsListener;
00172 
00173         // Ask to the service factory to create a Service. The service is not
00174         // register yet. We do not provide the service class, the default value 'Service'
00175         // will be used
00176         Service * pAccuServer = ServiceFactory.Create( "Accumulator" );
00177 
00178         // If something tricky occurred, exit
00179         if ( pAccuServer == NULL )
00180         {
00181                 fprintf( stderr, "Could not register the Accumulator service.\n" );
00182 
00183                 // Exit the thread
00184                 return -1;
00185         }
00186 
00187         // Just add a Variable of ReadAccess (read only) that can not be modifies by other services.
00188         // Set its value to the starting value
00189         pAccuServer->AddVariable( "Accu", "float", "Accumulator value", ReadAccess );
00190         pAccuServer->SetVariableValue( "Accu", 0.0f );
00191 
00192         // Add a Connector to receive and send messages (AnInOutput) and set my callback
00193         // object to receive notification of messages
00194         pAccuServer->AddConnector( "Commands", "Input for commands. output of errors.", AnInOutput );
00195         pAccuServer->AddConnectorListener( "Commands", &MyCommandsListener );
00196 
00197         // register the service and launch everything   
00198         pAccuServer->Start();
00199 
00200         // Trace
00201         fprintf( stderr, "Accumulator service started.\n" );
00202 
00203         // Create an Event and wait for it. As no one will signal it, we will
00204         // stay forever stuck here.
00205         Event Forever;
00206         Forever.Wait();
00207 
00208         // exit
00209         return 0;
00210 }
